intro: Conradia neglecta, commonly known as the slender bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and small, bladder-like structures that trap microscopic organisms. This plant is typically found in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and ditches. It has a short growing season and is often overlooked due to its inconspicuous appearance. Its botanical features make it an important part of aquatic ecosystems, supporting a variety of microfauna.
